text: 300ml bottle. Close to being clear. No head. Aroma of wood and green apple. Taste has light wood, vanilla, melon. Smooth, good drinkability, no burn or harshness. Good stuff.
Sampled at Naraziumi Yuaai. Very sweet, dessertlike, has a light ricey, slightly floral character, accented by the fizziness. I do not pick up a distinct taruzake character.

Liten flaske på Kita restaurant i Stavanger. Klar svakt grønnlig kropp uten hode. Boozy grappa med vinøse toner i nesa. Tyktflytende flat, søtlig og svakt fruktsyrlig smak med litt pepperaktige toner. Litt alkovarme.

300ml bottle. Clear with a slight yellowish tinge, no head and nose of rice, fruity, wood, spice. Flavour is sweetish, rice, caramel, wood, peppery, earthy, grassy, with warming alcohol. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, dry warm earthy through to a clean finish. Nicely drinkable.

Glass #2 at working sake lunch. pours light hazy waterish. Nice pronounced cedar spice on nose and taste. You also get pineapple, black pepper, and fresh cantaloupe. slightly milky palate touch of graininess.

Sampled at Sakaya NYC. A very dignified little plastic cup. Clear & still.

Online notes seem to be contradicting, but I think I got the jist from the rep. Breath. Using 80+yr old cedar trees, only the richest planks near the core, aged for a very short duration in comparison to other spirits(only weeks apparently), & the barrels are only used up to three times before being discarded. Exhale.

Nose is sharp with green wood & lacquer. A little hot.

Taste is a lot of barrel, bitter bark & cherry pit. the cedar comes off nearly like varnish-notes in a cheaper whiskey. Sleek body. Long, lightly acidic, biting finish.

Could be better, but it was unique enough to stand out at the tasting.
user_location: FT: Stale Polotmavý in Queens, New York, USA

Quite pale colour, no head. Aroma is cedar, some mild alcohol and spices. Flavour is being quite much the same along with some slight rice and mild sappy notes. Quite different from other Sakés I have had.

Bottle 300ml.Clear cristal clear color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate rice, white pepper. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average duration, soft flavor, light spicy pepper (cedar). Body is medium, texture is creamy and smooth, carbonation is flat. [20100523]
bottle at chris-o ... very very clear... soft rice little peppery soft nose  ... very soft ... very mellow ...  almost lychee ... little sweetness ... so so drinkable

300 ml bottle. Aroma of cedar, with retronasal alcohol and rice. Rather simple, dominated by cedar. Woody, citrus, flavor, sweet, lightly milky and fruity, with cherries or strawberries, and cedar. Smooth palate, rather full body. Decent stuff, the cedar is dominant, but the sake works with it well.
Light straw colour. Cedarwood and herbal aroma. Potent cedarwood flavours with hints of aniseed. Good balance. A very good taru sake.
